jobs.title: Digital Marketing Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who We Are:

We believe that open-source software, open standards and APIs are the greatest transformational tools for organizations in the modern software development era.

Our mission at Diagrid is to provide developers with APIs and tools that help them focus on their code and not on infrastructure. As online digital services need to handle more load and run on multiple clouds or on-premises environments, programming to higher level abstractions delivers consistent, secure and reliable code that is easily portable and helps organizations de-risk their projects.

Diagrid is founded by the creators of the Dapr and KEDA open-source projects, and who led the user experience, design and development of hyper-scale infrastructure cloud services, serverless platforms and open-source projects at Microsoft. Dapr has now achieved graduated status within the CNCF, joining renowned projects like Kubernetes, Prometheus, and Istio.

We are backed by top VC firms and supported with industry leading investors and advisors including Joe Beda (Kubernetes Co-Founder, former Co-Founder / CTO at Heptio) Matt Klein (Creator of Envoy, Lyft), Mark Russinovich (CTO, Microsoft Azure), William Morgan (Creator of Linkerd, CEO Buoyant), Seth Vargo (Senior Staff Engineer, Google), Adam Gross (Former CEO, Heroku), Sri Viswanath (Former CTO, Atlassian), Adam Frankl (Dev Marketing Expert, Neo4J & JFrog), and Roopak Venkatakrishnan (Head of platforms, Bolt).

About the Role:

We are looking for a Digital Marketing Manager to join our team and take ownership of the tactical execution of our marketing initiatives. This role is an exciting opportunity to work across the full spectrum of marketing disciplines, with the ability to shape processes, drive measurable impact, and grow your career alongside our company.

The Digital Marketing Manager will be responsible for managing day-to-day marketing operations and campaigns across social media, email, events, content, and web. You’ll report directly to the Head of Marketing, collaborate closely with sales, product, and engineering, and play a critical role in building and scaling Diagrid’s marketing function.

Your first priorities will include:

  • Planning Diagrid’s upcoming conference participation

  • Setting up and running webinars (acting as technical host)

  • Taking over the content calendar for blogs and videos

Responsibilities:

Social Media & Content

  • Execute the company’s social media strategy using automation tools.

  • Track industry news and share relevant updates.

  • Manage the content creation process (blogs, videos, graphics) to engage our developer and enterprise audiences.

Website Management

  • Keep the company website up to date using Webflow.

  • Manage ongoing updates and ensure a user-friendly experience.

  • Support SEO/SEM initiatives to improve visibility.

Events & Webinars

  • Plan and manage both in-person and virtual events, from small meetups to large conferences.

  • Serve as the technical host for webinars, ensuring smooth execution.

Email & Communications

  • Manage newsletters and outbound email campaigns in HubSpot.

  • Create, optimize, and maintain email automations and sequences.

Demand Generation

  • Execute multi-channel demand generation campaigns (social, paid ads, email).

  • Collaborate with sales on lead nurturing and conversion strategies.

Analytics & Reporting

  • Track campaign performance, social engagement, and website traffic.

  • Provide regular reports and insights to the Head of Marketing.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Work across sales, engineering, and leadership to align marketing efforts.

  • Proactively suggest and implement process improvements.

Tools You'll Work With:

  • HubSpot CRM & Marketing Automation

  • Google Analytics

  • Webflow

  • Canva (with agency support)

  • YouTube

  • Slack & GSuite

  • Linear (task management)

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Engineering, or Humanities (with relevant marketing experience and understanding of software engineering).

  • 3+ years of experience in a marketing role, ideally with a B2B SaaS vendor.

  • Demonstrated experience producing digital content (blogs, videos, eBooks, emails, social posts).

  • Proficiency in social media platforms and basic design tools (Canva).

  • Basic video editing experience for social media, webinars

  • Familiarity with CMS and website management (ideally WebFlow)

  • Experience with webinars/events coordination.

  • Strong project management skills with meticulous attention to detail (i.e. no typos, broken links, or inaccurate dates).

  • Ability to analyze metrics and translate them into actionable insights.

  • Comfort working in a fast-paced startup environment with adaptability and initiative.

Why join us?

At Diagrid, you'll:

  • Have the chance to shape the foundation of our marketing function.

  • Work directly with leadership and across teams for high visibility.

  • Be part of a company making a major impact in the open source and cloud-native ecosystems.

  • Gain the experience and exposure needed to grow into larger roles in your marketing career.

When you apply on the application form, write the code "DIA2025" in the box "What is it about Diagrid that makes you interested to work here?" along with your answer to that question, so that we know you read through the entire description.

Diagrid Benefits:

  • Competitive compensation

  • Company equity

  • Remote first & flexible work environment

  • Flexible paid time off

  • Comprehensive healthcare for you and your dependents

  • Choice of hardware

  • $1000 for home office setup

  • Monthly WFH stipend

  • Team events & gatherings

  • Chance to collaborate with industry-leading figures 

Diagrid, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. We embrace and celebrate differences and diversity.

jobs.title: Technical Product Marketing Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who We Are:

We believe that open-source software, open standards and APIs are the greatest transformational tools for organizations in the modern software development era.

Our mission at Diagrid is to provide developers with APIs and tools that help them focus on their code and not on infrastructure. As online digital services need to handle more load and run on multiple clouds or on-premises environments, programming to higher level abstractions delivers consistent, secure and reliable code that is easily portable and helps organizations de-risk their projects.

Diagrid is founded by the creators of the Dapr and KEDA open-source projects, and who led the user experience, design and development of hyper-scale infrastructure cloud services, serverless platforms and open-source projects at Microsoft. Dapr has now achieved graduated status within the CNCF, joining renowned projects like Kubernetes, Prometheus, and Istio.

We are backed by top VC firms and supported with industry leading investors and advisors including Joe Beda (Kubernetes Co-Founder, former Co-Founder / CTO at Heptio) Matt Klein (Creator of Envoy, Lyft), Mark Russinovich (CTO, Microsoft Azure), William Morgan (Creator of Linkerd, CEO Buoyant), Seth Vargo (Senior Staff Engineer, Google), Adam Gross (Former CEO, Heroku), Sri Viswanath (Former CTO, Atlassian), Adam Frankl (Dev Marketing Expert, Neo4J & JFrog), and Roopak Venkatakrishnan (Head of platforms, Bolt).

About the Role:

We're seeking an experienced Technical Marketing Manager to join our fully remote team and drive go-to-market strategy for our growing product portfolio. You'll be the strategic voice that translates our technical innovations into compelling market narratives, working at the intersection of our open-source Dapr community and enterprise customer needs.

You will work closely with our product managers, engineering, sales engineers, and customer success engineering. The role reports directly to the head of Marketing.

This role is perfect for a seasoned product marketer who thrives in the developer tools space and understands the unique dynamics of open-core business models. You'll own all product marketing deliverables while helping shape how we communicate the value of distributed systems solutions to technical and business audiences.

What You'll Own:

Product Positioning & Messaging

  • Develop compelling positioning and messaging for Diagrid Enterprise, Diagrid Catalyst, and future product offerings

  • Create differentiated value propositions that resonate with both technical decision-makers and business stakeholders

  • Establish clear product narratives that connect open-source Dapr benefits to enterprise commercial value

  • Highlights product benefits to both the development community and the platform/SRE teams who deploy and maintain those applications

New Launch Planning & Execution

  • Lead product launch strategies from planning through execution

  • Develop comprehensive launch plans including positioning, pricing guidance, sales enablement, and demand generation support

  • Coordinate cross-functional launch activities across product, sales, marketing, and customer success teams

Competitive Intelligence & Market Analysis

  • Monitor competitive landscape in the microservices, workflow orchestration, and developer platform spaces

  • Conduct market research to identify opportunities and validate product-market fit

  • Develop competitive battle cards and objection handling for sales teams

Content & Sales Enablement

  • Create high-impact marketing collateral, including solution briefs, case studies, whitepapers, and demo scripts

  • Help develop sales tools, training materials, and competitive positioning documents for the commercial offerings

  • Partner with engineering and the founders to create thought leadership content that drives demand

Customer & Community Insights

  • Conduct customer interviews and gather feedback to inform the product roadmap and marketing strategy

  • Build intelligence around the open-source usage

  • Develop customer advocacy programs and success stories

Demand Generation Support

  • Collaborate on campaign strategy and content development

  • Support event marketing including conference presentations, webinars, and trade shows

What We're Looking For:

Essential Experience

  • 4-6 years of product marketing experience in B2B technology companies

  • Proven experience with open-core or open-source business models

  • Strong background in developer tools, infrastructure, or cloud platforms

  • Track record of successful product launches and go-to-market execution

  • Proven experience in applying new AI-driven approaches to accelerating your work (writing, reporting, etc.)

Technical Understanding

  • Solid grasp of microservices architecture, distributed systems, and cloud-native development. We would expect you to have comfort and competence to the level that you can demo our code-first solution and articulate the core functions and primitives.

  • Ability to understand technical concepts and translate them into business value

  • Experience marketing to both developers and DevOps audiences

Core Competencies

  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

  • Strong analytical skills with experience using AI and data to drive decisions

  • Project planning, with attention to detail

  • Collaborative mindset with the ability to work cross-functionally

  • Self-starter who thrives in fast-paced, remote environments

  • Customer-centric approach with strong empathy for user needs

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with workflow orchestration, AI/ML platforms, or enterprise infrastructure solutions

  • Background in both technical and business stakeholder communication

  • Previous experience at high-growth B2B SaaS companies

  • Familiarity with open-source community dynamics and contribution models

Our Product Portfolio:

You'll be marketing an exciting and expanding portfolio:

Diagrid Enterprise - A comprehensive packaged solution for enterprises running Dapr in production, including enterprise support, advanced tooling, and a private distribution of Dapr with enhanced security and compliance features.

Diagrid Catalyst - A hosted workflow engine that provides access to all Dapr building blocks, specifically optimized for agentic processes and AI-driven applications.

Emerging Solutions - AI-assisted workflow generators, online university courses, and additional developer productivity tools that extend the Diagrid ecosystem.

Why You'll Love Working Here:

Our Values Drive Everything We Do

  • Humility - We stay grounded and attentive to ourselves and our users, letting humility guide everything we do

  • Collaboration - We believe the biggest catalyst for innovation is the ability to collaborate, bringing different perspectives to foster the best solutions

  • Courage - We dare to try the unconventional, be decisive, and stand up for what we believe in

  • Trust - Trust is our cornerstone - we speak with integrity, and stay real and truthful

Diagrid Benefits:

  • Competitive compensation

  • Company equity

  • Remote first & flexible work environment

  • Flexible paid time off

  • Comprehensive healthcare for you and your dependents

  • Choice of hardware

  • $1000 for home office setup

  • Monthly WFH stipend

  • Team events & gatherings

  • Chance to collaborate with industry-leading figures 

Diagrid, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. We embrace and celebrate differences and diversity.

jobs.descriptionHtml:

We believe that open-source software, open standards and APIs are the greatest transformational tools for organizations in the modern software development era.

As online digital services need to handle more load and run on multiple clouds or on-premises environments, programming to higher level abstractions delivers consistent, secure and reliable code that is easily portable and helps organizations de-risk their projects.

About Diagrid

Diagrid (diagrid.io) is the team behind Dapr, the open-source distributed application runtime trusted by developers worldwide. As the primary maintainer of Dapr, we are building next-generation solutions for modern cloud-native and AI-driven applications. Our commercial offerings are focused on:

  • Diagrid Enterprise: Enterprise-grade support packages for Dapr adoption.

  • Catalyst: A workflow engine purpose-built for distributed applications and Agentic AI.

We are a small, ambitious team working at the forefront of distributed systems and developer experience, and we’re looking for a founding Head of Business Development to help scale our go-to-market efforts.

About the Role

As the primary commercial entity and core maintainer behind the wildly successful open-source project Dapr (dapr.io), Diagrid offers powerful solutions like Diagrid Enterprise (our support packages) and Catalyst (our workflow engine for distributed applications and Agentic AI).

With rapidly growing interest in our solutions, Diagrid is looking for a founding Business Development Lead to join our go-to-market team. This isn't a role for an entry-level BDR; it's an opportunity for an ambitious, hands-on leader to build and scale our entire business development function.

This is not a traditional BDR role where you’re handed a script and expected to follow it. As our first senior business development hire, you will be responsible for scaling and improving our demand generation and lead management processes.

You will partner closely with our account executives and founders, directly influencing how we attract, qualify, and convert opportunities. This is a career-defining opportunity for someone who thrives in early-stage environments and wants to shape the future of a high-growth developer tools company.

Responsibilities

You will:

  • System Ownership

    • Serve as HubSpot and AmpleMarket administrator, configuring and monitoring email sequences, lead lists, and automations.

    • Explore and implement additional tools to enhance our sales tech stack (current stack includes AmpleMarket, HubSpot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and Clay.com).

  • Spearhead Lead Management

    • Generate and qualify leads using Dapr user intelligence and tools such as AmpleMarket and LinkedIn.

    • Review, organize, and triage inbound leads for follow-up.

  • Outbound Strategy & Execution

    • Ideate, create, and continuously optimize outbound prospecting sequences.

    • Automate and improve campaigns using AmpleMarket and other modern tools.

    • Support founders and AEs with outbound activities, including running outreach sequences and LinkedIn interactions on their behalf.

    • Help define and prioritize sales support materials and engineering resources to help accelerate deals.

  • Reporting & Optimization

    • Monitor and report on business development performance.

    • Continuously refine outreach strategies based on conversion data.

  • Team Building & Leadership

    • Help define and refine the BDR playbook for Diagrid.

    • Recruit, mentor, and manage future BDR hires.

    • Grow into managing a demand generation team as the company scales.

Who We're Looking For

You are not a beginner. You're someone who thrives on building systems and processes from scratch. We need a strategic thinker who is also an exceptional executor—someone who can both design the playbook and run the plays.

We’re looking for someone who:

  • Has 3–5+ years of experience in business development, demand generation, or sales operations at a high-growth B2B SaaS company.

  • A data-driven mindset and a knack for optimizing campaigns based on performance metrics.

  • Thrives in startup environments where self-sufficiency is the norm and building processes is part of the job.The ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, small-team environment.

  • Demonstrates strong sales automation and CRM expertise (HubSpot + Amplemerket preferred).

  • Demonstrable skill at building outbound campaigns and optimizing for measurable results.

  • Understands developer-focused markets (ideally in an open-source setting) or has the ability to quickly learn and adapt to technical audiences.

  • Possesses excellent communication skills, with the ability to represent Diagrid credibly in written and verbal outreach.

  • Shows leadership potential, with an interest in growing into a management role.

  • A clear interest in open-source technology and the distributed application space.

This role is a clear path to becoming a leader within our organization. We expect you to play a vital role in recruiting future BDRs and ultimately, demonstrate the aptitude to manage our growing demand generation function.

Why Join Us?

  • Be the founding BDR/SalesOps leader at a company redefining how distributed systems and AI applications are built.

  • Work closely with our founders and early sales team, directly shaping go-to-market strategy.

  • Join a globally distributed, remote-first team with a developer-first culture.

  • Build a scalable business development function with the opportunity to grow into a leadership role as Diagrid expands.

If you're ready to define and build the future of business development at Diagrid, we encourage you to apply.

Diagrid Benefits:

  • Competitive compensation

  • Company equity

  • Remote first & flexible work environment

  • Flexible paid time off

  • Comprehensive healthcare for you and your dependents

  • Choice of hardware

  • $1000 for home office setup

  • Monthly WFH stipend

  • Team events & gatherings

  • Chance to collaborate with industry-leading figures 

Diagrid, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. We embrace and celebrate differences and diversity.

As online digital services need to handle more load and run on multiple clouds or on-premises environments, programming to higher level abstractions delivers consistent, secure and reliable code that is easily portable and helps organizations de-risk their projects.

Diagrid is founded by the creators of the Dapr https://dapr.io/ and KEDA https://keda.sh/ open-source projects, and who led the user experience, design and development of hyper-scale infrastructure cloud services, serverless platforms and open-source projects at Microsoft. Dapr has now achieved graduated status within the CNCF, joining renowned projects like Kubernetes, Prometheus, and Istio.

We are backed by top VC firms and supported with industry leading investors and advisors including Joe Beda (Kubernetes Co-Founder, former Co-Founder / CTO at Heptio) Matt Klein (Creator of Envoy, Lyft), Mark Russinovich (CTO, Microsoft Azure), William Morgan (Creator of Linkerd, CEO Buoyant), Seth Vargo (Senior Staff Engineer, Google), Adam Gross (Former CEO, Heroku), Sri Viswanath (Former CTO, Atlassian), Adam Frankl (Dev Marketing Expert, Neo4J & JFrog), and Roopak Venkatakrishnan (Head of platforms, Bolt).

About Diagrid

Diagrid (diagrid.io http://diagrid.io) is the team behind Dapr https://dapr.io, the open-source distributed application runtime trusted by developers worldwide. As the primary maintainer of Dapr, we are building next-generation solutions for modern cloud-native and AI-driven applications. Our commercial offerings are focused on:

 - Diagrid Enterprise: Enterprise-grade support packages for Dapr adoption.

 - Catalyst: A workflow engine purpose-built for distributed applications and Agentic AI.

We are a small, ambitious team working at the forefront of distributed systems and developer experience, and we’re looking for a founding Head of Business Development to help scale our go-to-market efforts.

About the Role

As the primary commercial entity and core maintainer behind the wildly successful open-source project Dapr (dapr.io http://dapr.io), Diagrid offers powerful solutions like Diagrid Enterprise https://www.diagrid.io/dapr-for-enterprise (our support packages) and Catalyst https://www.diagrid.io/catalyst (our workflow engine for distributed applications and Agentic AI).

With rapidly growing interest in our solutions, Diagrid is looking for a founding Business Development Lead to join our go-to-market team. This isn't a role for an entry-level BDR; it's an opportunity for an ambitious, hands-on leader to build and scale our entire business development function.

This is not a traditional BDR role where you’re handed a script and expected to follow it. As our first senior business development hire, you will be responsible for scaling and improving our demand generation and lead management processes.

You will partner closely with our account executives and founders, directly influencing how we attract, qualify, and convert opportunities. This is a career-defining opportunity for someone who thrives in early-stage environments and wants to shape the future of a high-growth developer tools company.

Responsibilities

You will:

 - System Ownership
   
   - Serve as HubSpot and AmpleMarket administrator, configuring and monitoring email sequences, lead lists, and automations.
   
   - Explore and implement additional tools to enhance our sales tech stack (current stack includes AmpleMarket, HubSpot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and Clay.com http://Clay.com).

 - Spearhead Lead Management
   
   - Generate and qualify leads using Dapr user intelligence and tools such as AmpleMarket and LinkedIn.
   
   - Review, organize, and triage inbound leads for follow-up.
     

 - Outbound Strategy & Execution
   
   - Ideate, create, and continuously optimize outbound prospecting sequences.
   
   - Automate and improve campaigns using AmpleMarket and other modern tools.
   
   - Support founders and AEs with outbound activities, including running outreach sequences and LinkedIn interactions on their behalf.
   
   - Help define and prioritize sales support materials and engineering resources to help accelerate deals.
     

 - Reporting & Optimization
   
   - Monitor and report on business development performance.
   
   - Continuously refine outreach strategies based on conversion data.
     

 - Team Building & Leadership
   
   - Help define and refine the BDR playbook for Diagrid.
   
   - Recruit, mentor, and manage future BDR hires.
   
   - Grow into managing a demand generation team as the company scales.

Who We're Looking For

You are not a beginner. You're someone who thrives on building systems and processes from scratch. We need a strategic thinker who is also an exceptional executor—someone who can both design the playbook and run the plays.

We’re looking for someone who:

 - Has 3–5+ years of experience in business development, demand generation, or sales operations at a high-growth B2B SaaS company.
   

 - A data-driven mindset and a knack for optimizing campaigns based on performance metrics.
   

 - Thrives in startup environments where self-sufficiency is the norm and building processes is part of the job.The ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, small-team environment.
   

 - Demonstrates strong sales automation and CRM expertise (HubSpot + Amplemerket preferred).
   

 - Demonstrable skill at building outbound campaigns and optimizing for measurable results.
   

 - Understands developer-focused markets (ideally in an open-source setting) or has the ability to quickly learn and adapt to technical audiences.
   

 - Possesses excellent communication skills, with the ability to represent Diagrid credibly in written and verbal outreach.
   

 - Shows leadership potential, with an interest in growing into a management role.
   

 - A clear interest in open-source technology and the distributed application space.

This role is a clear path to becoming a leader within our organization. We expect you to play a vital role in recruiting future BDRs and ultimately, demonstrate the aptitude to manage our growing demand generation function.

Why Join Us?

 - Be the founding BDR/SalesOps leader at a company redefining how distributed systems and AI applications are built.
   

 - Work closely with our founders and early sales team, directly shaping go-to-market strategy.
   

 - Join a globally distributed, remote-first team with a developer-first culture.
   

 - Build a scalable business development function with the opportunity to grow into a leadership role as Diagrid expands.
   

If you're ready to define and build the future of business development at Diagrid, we encourage you to apply.


DIAGRID BENEFITS:

 - Competitive compensation

 - Remote first & flexible work environment

 - Flexible paid time off

 - Comprehensive healthcare for you and your dependents

About the Role:

We are looking for a Marketing Manager - Developer Tools to join our team and take ownership of the tactical execution of our marketing initiatives. This role is an exciting opportunity to work across the full spectrum of marketing disciplines, with the ability to shape processes, drive measurable impact, and grow your career alongside our company.

The Marketing Manager - Developer Tools will be responsible for managing day-to-day marketing operations and campaigns across social media, email, events, content, and web. You’ll report directly to the Head of Marketing, collaborate closely with sales, product, and engineering, and play a critical role in building and scaling Diagrid’s marketing function.

Your first priorities will include:

  • Planning Diagrid’s upcoming conference participation

  • Setting up and running webinars (acting as technical host)

  • Taking over the content calendar for blogs and videos

Responsibilities:

Social Media & Content

  • Execute the company’s social media strategy using automation tools.

  • Track industry news and share relevant updates.

  • Manage the content creation process (blogs, videos, graphics) to engage our developer and enterprise audiences.

Website Management

  • Keep the company website up to date using Webflow.

  • Manage ongoing updates and ensure a user-friendly experience.

  • Support SEO/SEM initiatives to improve visibility.

Events & Webinars

  • Plan and manage both in-person and virtual events, from small meetups to large conferences.

  • Serve as the technical host for webinars, ensuring smooth execution.

Email & Communications

  • Manage newsletters and outbound email campaigns in HubSpot.

  • Create, optimize, and maintain email automations and sequences.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Work across sales, engineering, and leadership to align marketing efforts.

  • Proactively suggest and implement process improvements.

Tools You'll Work With:

  • HubSpot CRM & Marketing Automation

  • Google Analytics

  • Webflow

  • Canva (with agency support)

  • YouTube

  • Slack & GSuite

  • Linear (task management)

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Engineering, or Humanities (with relevant marketing experience and understanding of software engineering).

  • 3+ years of experience in a marketing role, ideally with a B2B SaaS vendor.

  • Demonstrated experience producing digital content (blogs, videos, eBooks, emails, social posts).

  • Proficiency in social media platforms and basic design tools (Canva).

  • Basic video editing experience for social media, webinars

  • Familiarity with CMS and website management (ideally WebFlow)

  • Experience with webinars/events coordination.

  • Strong project management skills with meticulous attention to detail (i.e. no typos, broken links, or inaccurate dates).

  • Ability to analyze metrics and translate them into actionable insights.

  • Comfort working in a fast-paced startup environment with adaptability and initiative.

Why join us?

At Diagrid, you'll:

  • Have the chance to shape the foundation of our marketing function.

  • Work directly with leadership and across teams for high visibility.

  • Be part of a company making a major impact in the open source and cloud-native ecosystems.

  • Gain the experience and exposure needed to grow into larger roles in your marketing career.

When you apply on the application form, write the code "DIA2025" in the box "What is it about Diagrid that makes you interested to work here?" along with your answer to that question, so that we know you read through the entire description.

Diagrid Benefits:

  • Competitive compensation

  • Company equity

  • Remote first & flexible work environment

  • Flexible paid time off

  • Comprehensive healthcare for you and your dependents

  • Choice of hardware

  • $1000 for home office setup

  • Monthly WFH stipend

  • Team events & gatherings

  • Chance to collaborate with industry-leading figures

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Diagrid Cloud
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who We Are:

We believe that open-source software, open standards and APIs are the greatest transformational tools for organizations in the modern software development era.

Our mission at Diagrid is to provide developers with APIs and tools that help them focus on their code and not on infrastructure. As online digital services need to handle more load and run on multiple clouds or on-premises environments, programming to higher level abstractions delivers consistent, secure and reliable code that is easily portable and helps organizations de-risk their projects.

Diagrid is founded by the creators of the Dapr and KEDA open-source projects, and who led the user experience, design and development of hyper-scale infrastructure cloud services, serverless platforms and open-source projects at Microsoft. Dapr has now achieved graduated status within the CNCF, joining renowned projects like Kubernetes, Prometheus, and Istio.

We are backed by top VC firms and supported with industry leading investors and advisors including Joe Beda (Kubernetes Co-Founder, former Co-Founder / CTO at Heptio) Matt Klein (Creator of Envoy, Lyft), Mark Russinovich (CTO, Microsoft Azure), William Morgan (Creator of Linkerd, CEO Buoyant), Seth Vargo (Senior Staff Engineer, Google), Adam Gross (Former CEO, Heroku), Sri Viswanath (Former CTO, Atlassian), Adam Frankl (Dev Marketing Expert, Neo4J & JFrog), and Roopak Venkatakrishnan (Head of platforms, Bolt).

About the Role

Diagrid’s mission is to make building and running cloud-native applications radically simpler. We’re the creators of Conductor, a SaaS platform that automates and streamlines the operational complexity of running Dapr in production. From automated upgrades and certificate management to deep observability and cost optimization, Conductor empowers developers to focus on features instead of managing infrastructure.

Alongside it, Catalyst provides a fully managed, API-driven environment that allows developers to harness Dapr’s building blocks without operating their own infrastructure. With Catalyst, teams can rapidly build event-driven and stateful applications while eliminating the burden of cluster setup, scaling, and security. Together, Conductor and Catalyst give organizations the power to innovate faster by unifying developer productivity with operational excellence.

We’re a distributed, collaborative team with deep experience in developer tools, distributed systems, and open-source software. We believe in using the right tool for the right job while leaning on open-source standards and cloud-native best practices.

We’re looking for Senior Software Engineers to join the team building Diagrid Cloud. You’ll work across the stack to design, build, and operate core features that help our customers run Dapr and Kubernetes-based systems at scale. This is a hands-on engineering role where you’ll be deeply involved in product architecture, performance optimization, and delivering a best-in-class developer experience.

You will get to work on delivering cutting-edge features and improving the operational excellence of our services, bringing industry best practices to monitor, remediate, and prevent incidents.

You are a great fit if you love operational excellence as much as building new features, while tackling the challenges of complex distributed systems.

Responsibilities

  • Design and build new Diagrid Cloud capabilities, from backend services to frontend user experiences.

  • Develop features around Dapr operations, Kubernetes orchestration, observability, and cost optimization.

  • Integrate with cloud provider APIs and Kubernetes APIs to automate operational workflows.

  • Work with Go and cloud-native tooling to deliver secure, scalable features.

  • Collaborate with product, design, and support teams to deliver customer-driven enhancements.

  • Participate in architectural discussions, code reviews, and continuous improvement of our engineering practices.

  • Contribute to system reliability by owning features end-to-end—from design and testing to deployment and monitoring.

  • Mentor other engineers and share expertise in cloud-native development, distributed systems, and SaaS product delivery.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in designing and building distributed systems

  • 2+ years operating a public cloud service or platform in production

  • 2+ years of experience with Go

  • 2+ years of experience with Kubernetes, Docker or other container based systems

  • 2+ years of experience with Google Cloud or similar cloud provider

  • Solid understanding of computer science principles with a focus on distributed systems

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Ability to mentor early-career engineers

  • Bonus: experience with Dapr

    ‍

Our Tech Stack

At Diagrid, we believe in using open-source tools and protocols to get the job done, while respecting the age old "pick the right tool for the right job" saying. As such, we expect our tech stack to be dynamic and evolving in nature while retaining our open-source strategy.

We use:

- Golang

- Node.js

- Typescript

- React

- Redux

- MySQL 8.x with InnoDB

- Cortex

- Kubernetes

- Docker

- Envoy

- Multiple cloud platforms, mainly GCP


Diagrid Benefits:

  • Competitive compensation

  • Company equity

  • Remote first & flexible work environment

  • Flexible paid time off

  • Comprehensive healthcare for you and your dependents

  • Choice of hardware

  • $1000 for home office setup

  • Monthly WFH stipend

  • Team events & gatherings

  • Chance to collaborate with industry-leading figures

All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. We embrace and celebrate differences and diversity.
